419target_handler::trajectory target_handler::mode_fire( avatar &you, aim_activity_actor &activity )
420{
421 target_ui ui = target_ui();
422 ui.you = &you;
423 ui.mode = target_ui::TargetMode::Fire;
424 ui.activity = &activity;
425 ui.relevant = activity.get_weapon();
426
427 return ui.run();
428}

430target_handler::trajectory target_handler::mode_throw( avatar &you, item &relevant,

435 ui.mode = blind_throwing ? target_ui::TargetMode::ThrowBlind : target_ui::TargetMode::Throw;

463
464target_handler::trajectory target_handler::mode_turrets( avatar &you, vehicle &veh,
465 const std::vector<vehicle_part *> &turrets )
466{
467 // Find radius of a circle centered at u encompassing all points turrets can aim at
468 // FIXME: this calculation is fine for square distances, but results in an underestimation
469 // when used with real circles
470 int range_total = 0;
471 for( vehicle_part *t : turrets ) {
472 int range = veh.turret_query( *t ).range();
473 tripoint pos = veh.global_part_pos3( *t );
474
475 int res = 0;
476 res = std::max( res, rl_dist( you.pos(), pos + point( range, 0 ) ) );
477 res = std::max( res, rl_dist( you.pos(), pos + point( -range, 0 ) ) );
478 res = std::max( res, rl_dist( you.pos(), pos + point( 0, range ) ) );
479 res = std::max( res, rl_dist( you.pos(), pos + point( 0, -range ) ) );
480 range_total = std::max( range_total, res );
481 }
482
483 target_ui ui = target_ui();
484 ui.you = &you;
485 ui.mode = target_ui::TargetMode::Turrets;
486 ui.veh = &veh;
487 ui.vturrets = &turrets;
488 ui.range = range_total;
489
490 return ui.run();
491}
492

520
521static double occupied_tile_fraction( m_size target_size )
522{
523 switch( target_size ) {
524 case MS_TINY:
525 return 0.1;
526 case MS_SMALL:
527 return 0.25;
528 case MS_MEDIUM:
529 return 0.5;
530 case MS_LARGE:
531 return 0.75;
532 case MS_HUGE:
533 return 1.0;
534 default:
535 break;
536 }
537
538 return 0.5;
539}
540
541double Creature::ranged_target_size() const
542{
543 if( has_flag( MF_HARDTOSHOOT ) ) {
544 switch( get_size() ) {
545 case MS_TINY:
546 case MS_SMALL:
547 return occupied_tile_fraction( MS_TINY );
548 case MS_MEDIUM:
549 return occupied_tile_fraction( MS_SMALL );
550 case MS_LARGE:
551 return occupied_tile_fraction( MS_MEDIUM );
552 case MS_HUGE:
553 return occupied_tile_fraction( MS_LARGE );
554 default:
555 break;
556 }
557 }
558 return occupied_tile_fraction( get_size() );
559}
560
561int range_with_even_chance_of_good_hit( int dispersion )
562{
563 int even_chance_range = 0;
564 while( static_cast<unsigned>( even_chance_range ) <
565 Creature::dispersion_for_even_chance_of_good_hit.size() &&
566 dispersion < Creature::dispersion_for_even_chance_of_good_hit[ even_chance_range ] ) {
567 even_chance_range++;
568 }
569 return even_chance_range;
570}
571
572int player::gun_engagement_moves( const item &gun, int target, int start ) const
573{
574 int mv = 0;
575 double penalty = start;
576
577 while( penalty > target ) {
578 double adj = aim_per_move( gun, penalty );
579 if( adj <= 0 ) {
580 break;
581 }
582 penalty -= adj;
583 mv++;
584 }
585
586 return mv;
587}
588
589bool player::handle_gun_damage( item &it )
590{
591 // Below item (maximum dirt possible) should be greater than or equal to dirt range in item_group.cpp. Also keep in mind that monster drops can have specific ranges and these should be below the max!
592 const double dirt_max_dbl = 10000;
593 if( !it.is_gun() ) {
594 debugmsg( "Tried to handle_gun_damage of a non-gun %s", it.tname() );
595 return false;
596 }
597
598 int dirt = it.get_var( "dirt", 0 );
599 int dirtadder = 0;
600 double dirt_dbl = static_cast<double>( dirt );
601 if( it.faults.count( fault_gun_chamber_spent ) ) {
602 return false;
603 }
604
605 const auto &curammo_effects = it.ammo_effects();
606 const islot_gun &firing = *it.type->gun;
607 // misfire chance based on dirt accumulation. Formula is designed to make chance of jam highly unlikely at low dirt levels, but levels increase geometrically as the dirt level reaches max (10,000). The number used is just a figure I found reasonable after plugging the number into excel and changing it until the probability made sense at high, medium, and low levels of dirt.
608 if( !it.has_flag( flag_NEVER_JAMS ) &&
609 x_in_y( dirt_dbl * dirt_dbl * dirt_dbl,
610 1000000000000.0 ) ) {
611 add_msg_player_or_npc(
612 _( "Your %s misfires with a muffled click!" ),
613 _( "<npcname>'s %s misfires with a muffled click!" ),
614 it.tname() );
615 // at high dirt levels the chance to misfire gets to significant levels. 10,000 is max and 7800 is quite high so above that the player gets some relief in the form of exchanging time for some dirt reduction. Basically jiggling the parts loose to remove some dirt and get a few more shots out.
616 if( dirt_dbl >
617 7800 ) {
618 add_msg_player_or_npc(
619 _( "Perhaps taking the ammo out of your %s and reloading will help." ),
620 _( "Perhaps taking the ammo out of <npcname>'s %s and reloading will help." ),
621 it.tname() );
622 }
623 return false;
624 }
625
626 // Here we check if we're underwater and whether we should misfire.
627 // As a result this causes no damage to the firearm, note that some guns are waterproof
628 // and so are immune to this effect, note also that WATERPROOF_GUN status does not
629 // mean the gun will actually be accurate underwater.
630 int effective_durability = firing.durability;
631 if( is_underwater() && !it.has_flag( "WATERPROOF_GUN" ) && one_in( effective_durability ) ) {
632 add_msg_player_or_npc( _( "Your %s misfires with a wet click!" ),
633 _( "<npcname>'s %s misfires with a wet click!" ),
634 it.tname() );
635 return false;
636 // Here we check for a chance for the weapon to suffer a mechanical malfunction.
637 // Note that some weapons never jam up 'NEVER_JAMS' and thus are immune to this
638 // effect as current guns have a durability between 5 and 9 this results in
639 // a chance of mechanical failure between 1/(64*3) and 1/(1024*3) on any given shot.
640 // the malfunction can't cause damage
641 } else if( one_in( ( 2 << effective_durability ) * 3 ) && !it.has_flag( flag_NEVER_JAMS ) ) {
642 add_msg_player_or_npc( _( "Your %s malfunctions!" ),
643 _( "<npcname>'s %s malfunctions!" ),
644 it.tname() );
645 return false;
646 // Here we check for a chance for the weapon to suffer a misfire due to
647 // using player-made 'RECYCLED' bullets. Note that not all forms of
648 // player-made ammunition have this effect.
649 } else if( curammo_effects.count( ammo_effect_RECYCLED ) && one_in( 256 ) ) {
650 add_msg_player_or_npc( _( "Your %s misfires with a muffled click!" ),
651 _( "<npcname>'s %s misfires with a muffled click!" ),
652 it.tname() );
653 return false;
654 // Here we check for a chance for attached mods to get damaged if they are flagged as 'CONSUMABLE'.
655 // This is mostly for crappy handmade expedient stuff or things that rarely receive damage during normal usage.
656 // Default chance is 1/10000 unless set via json, damage is proportional to caliber(see below).
657 // Can be toned down with 'consume_divisor.'
658
659 } else if( it.has_flag( flag_CONSUMABLE ) && !curammo_effects.count( ammo_effect_LASER ) &&
660 !curammo_effects.count( ammo_effect_PLASMA ) && !curammo_effects.count( ammo_effect_EMP ) ) {
661 int uncork = ( ( 10 * it.ammo_data()->ammo->loudness )
662 + ( it.ammo_data()->ammo->recoil / 2 ) ) / 100;
663 uncork = std::pow( uncork, 3 ) * 6.5;
664 for( auto mod : it.gunmods() ) {
665 if( mod->has_flag( flag_CONSUMABLE ) ) {
666 int dmgamt = uncork / mod->type->gunmod->consume_divisor;
667 int modconsume = mod->type->gunmod->consume_chance;
668 int initstate = it.damage();
669 // fuzz damage if it's small
670 if( dmgamt < 1000 ) {
671 dmgamt = rng( dmgamt, dmgamt + 200 );
672 // ignore damage if inconsequential.
673 }
674 if( dmgamt < 800 ) {
675 dmgamt = 0;
676 }
677 if( one_in( modconsume ) ) {
678 if( mod->mod_damage( dmgamt ) ) {
679 add_msg_player_or_npc( m_bad, _( "Your attached %s is destroyed by your shot!" ),
680 _( "<npcname>'s attached %s is destroyed by their shot!" ),
681 mod->tname() );
682 i_rem( mod );
683 } else if( it.damage() > initstate ) {
684 add_msg_player_or_npc( m_bad, _( "Your attached %s is damaged by your shot!" ),
685 _( "<npcname>'s %s is damaged by their shot!" ),
686 mod->tname() );
687 }
688 }
689 }
690 }
691 }
692 if( it.has_fault( fault_gun_unlubricated ) &&
693 x_in_y( dirt_dbl, dirt_max_dbl ) ) {
694 add_msg_player_or_npc( m_bad, _( "Your %s emits a grimace-inducing screech!" ),
695 _( "<npcname>'s %s emits a grimace-inducing screech!" ),
696 it.tname() );
697 it.inc_damage();
698 }
699 if( ( ( !curammo_effects.count( ammo_effect_NON_FOULING ) && !it.has_flag( flag_NON_FOULING ) ) ||
700 ( it.has_fault( fault_gun_unlubricated ) ) ) &&
701 !it.has_flag( flag_PRIMITIVE_RANGED_WEAPON ) ) {
702 if( curammo_effects.count( ammo_effect_BLACKPOWDER ) ||
703 it.has_fault( fault_gun_unlubricated ) ) {
704 if( ( ( it.ammo_data()->ammo->recoil < firing.min_cycle_recoil ) ||
705 ( it.has_fault( fault_gun_unlubricated ) && one_in( 16 ) ) ) &&
706 it.faults_potential().count( fault_gun_chamber_spent ) ) {
707 add_msg_player_or_npc( m_bad, _( "Your %s fails to cycle!" ),
708 _( "<npcname>'s %s fails to cycle!" ),
709 it.tname() );
710 it.faults.insert( fault_gun_chamber_spent );
711 // Don't return false in this case; this shot happens, follow-up ones won't.
712 }
713 }
714 // These are the dirtying/fouling mechanics
715 if( !curammo_effects.count( ammo_effect_NON_FOULING ) && !it.has_flag( flag_NON_FOULING ) ) {
716 if( dirt < static_cast<int>( dirt_max_dbl ) ) {
717 dirtadder = curammo_effects.count( ammo_effect_BLACKPOWDER ) * ( 200 -
718 ( firing.blackpowder_tolerance *
719 2 ) );
720 // dirtadder is the dirt-increasing number for shots fired with gunpowder-based ammo. Usually dirt level increases by 1, unless it's blackpowder, in which case it increases by a higher number, but there is a reduction for blackpowder resistance of a weapon.
721 if( dirtadder < 0 ) {
722 dirtadder = 0;
723 }
724 // in addition to increasing dirt level faster, regular gunpowder fouling is also capped at 7,150, not 10,000. So firing with regular gunpowder can never make the gun quite as bad as firing it with black gunpowder. At 7,150 the chance to jam is significantly lower (though still significant) than it is at 10,000, the absolute cap.
725 if( curammo_effects.count( ammo_effect_BLACKPOWDER ) ||
726 dirt < 7150 ) {
727 it.set_var( "dirt", std::min( static_cast<int>( dirt_max_dbl ), dirt + dirtadder + 1 ) );
728 }
729 }
730 dirt = it.get_var( "dirt", 0 );
731 dirt_dbl = static_cast<double>( dirt );
732 if( dirt > 0 && !it.faults.count( fault_gun_blackpowder ) ) {
733 it.faults.insert( fault_gun_dirt );
734 }
735 if( dirt > 0 && curammo_effects.count( ammo_effect_BLACKPOWDER ) ) {
736 it.faults.erase( fault_gun_dirt );
737 it.faults.insert( fault_gun_blackpowder );
738 }
739 // end fouling mechanics
740 }
741 }
742 // chance to damage gun due to high levels of dirt. Very unlikely, especially at lower levels and impossible below 5,000. Lower than the chance of a jam at the same levels. 555555... is an arbitrary number that I came up with after playing with the formula in excel. It makes sense at low, medium, and high levels of dirt.
743 if( dirt_dbl > 5000 &&
744 x_in_y( dirt_dbl * dirt_dbl * dirt_dbl,
745 5555555555555 ) ) {
746 add_msg_player_or_npc( m_bad, _( "Your %s is damaged by the high pressure!" ),
747 _( "<npcname>'s %s is damaged by the high pressure!" ),
748 it.tname() );
749 // Don't increment until after the message
750 it.inc_damage();
751 }
752 return true;
753}
754
755void npc::pretend_fire( npc *source, int shots, item &gun )
756{
757 int curshot = 0;
758 if( g->u.sees( *source ) && one_in( 50 ) ) {
759 add_msg( m_info, _( "%s shoots something." ), source->disp_name() );
760 }
761 while( curshot != shots ) {
762 if( gun.ammo_consume( gun.ammo_required(), pos() ) != gun.ammo_required() ) {
763 debugmsg( "Unexpected shortage of ammo whilst firing %s", gun.tname().c_str() );
764 break;
765 }
766
767 item *weapon = &gun;
768 const auto data = weapon->gun_noise( shots > 1 );
769
770 if( g->u.sees( *source ) ) {
771 add_msg( m_warning, _( "You hear %s." ), data.sound );
772 }
773 curshot++;
774 moves -= 100;
775 }
776}
777
778bool can_use_bipod( const map &m, const tripoint &pos )
779{
780 // usage of any attached bipod is dependent upon terrain
781 if( m.has_flag_ter_or_furn( "MOUNTABLE", pos ) ) {
782 return true;
783 }
784
785 if( const optional_vpart_position vp = m.veh_at( pos ) ) {
786 return vp->vehicle().has_part( pos, "MOUNTABLE" );
787 }
788
789 return false;
790}
791
792dispersion_sources calculate_dispersion( const map &m, const player &p, const item &gun,
793 int at_recoil, bool burst )
794{
795 bool bipod = can_use_bipod( m, p.pos() );
796
797 int gun_recoil = gun.gun_recoil( bipod );
798 int eff_recoil = at_recoil + ( burst ? ranged::burst_penalty( p, gun, gun_recoil ) : 0 );
799 dispersion_sources dispersion( p.get_weapon_dispersion( gun ) );
800 dispersion.add_range( eff_recoil );
801 return dispersion;
802}
803
804int player::fire_gun( const tripoint &target, int shots )
805{
806 return fire_gun( target, shots, weapon );
807}
808
809int player::fire_gun( const tripoint &target, const int max_shots, item &gun )
810{
811 if( !gun.is_gun() ) {
812 debugmsg( "%s tried to fire non-gun (%s).", name, gun.tname() );
813 return 0;
814 }
815 bool is_mech_weapon = false;
816 if( is_mounted() &&
817 mounted_creature->has_flag( MF_RIDEABLE_MECH ) ) {
818 is_mech_weapon = true;
819 }
820
821 int shots = max_shots;
822 // Number of shots to fire is limited by the amount of remaining ammo
823 if( gun.ammo_required() ) {
824 shots = std::min( shots, static_cast<int>( gun.ammo_remaining() / gun.ammo_required() ) );
825 }
826
827 // cap our maximum burst size by the amount of UPS power left
828 if( !gun.has_flag( flag_VEHICLE ) && gun.get_gun_ups_drain() > 0 ) {
829 shots = std::min( shots, static_cast<int>( charges_of( itype_UPS ) / gun.get_gun_ups_drain() ) );
830 }
831
832 if( shots <= 0 ) {
833 debugmsg( "Attempted to fire zero or negative shots using %s", gun.tname() );
834 }
835
836 cata::optional<shape_factory> shape;
837 if( gun.ammo_current() && gun.ammo_current()->ammo ) {
838 shape = gun.ammo_current()->ammo->shape;
839 }
840
841 // Shaped attacks don't allow aiming, so they don't suffer from lack of aim either
842 int character_recoil = shape ? recoil_vehicle() : recoil_total();
843 // Penalty is (intentionally) based off mode shots, not ammo-limited.
844 dispersion_sources dispersion = calculate_dispersion( g->m, *this, gun, character_recoil,
845 max_shots > 1 );
846
847 bool aoe_attack = gun.gun_skill() == skill_launcher || shape;
848 tripoint aim = target;
849 int curshot = 0;
850 int hits = 0; // total shots on target
851 while( curshot != shots ) {
852 if( gun.faults.count( fault_gun_chamber_spent ) && curshot == 0 ) {
853 moves -= 50;
854 gun.faults.erase( fault_gun_chamber_spent );
855 add_msg_if_player( _( "You cycle your %s manually." ), gun.tname() );
856 }
857
858 if( !handle_gun_damage( gun ) ) {
859 break;
860 }
861
862 // If this is a vehicle mounted turret, which vehicle is it mounted on?
863 const vehicle *in_veh = has_effect( effect_on_roof ) ? veh_pointer_or_null( g->m.veh_at(
864 pos() ) ) : nullptr;
865 projectile projectile = make_gun_projectile( gun );
866
867 // Damage reduction from insufficient strength, if using a STR_DRAW weapon.
868 projectile.impact.mult_damage( ranged::str_draw_damage_modifier( gun, *this ) );
869
870 if( has_trait( trait_NORANGEDCRIT ) ) {
871 projectile.add_effect( ammo_effect_NO_CRIT );
872 }
873 if( !shape ) {
874 auto shot = projectile_attack( projectile, pos(), aim, dispersion, this, in_veh );
875 if( shot.missed_by <= .1 ) {
876 // TODO: check head existence for headshot
877 g->events().send<event_type::character_gets_headshot>( getID() );
878 }
879
880 if( shot.hit_critter ) {
881 hits++;
882 }
883 } else {
884 // 30 degree cap, like for projectiles
885 double angle_offset_arcmin = std::min( dispersion.roll(), 1800.0 ) * ( one_in( 2 ) ? 1 : -1 );
886 double angle_offset = units::to_radians( units::from_arcmin( angle_offset_arcmin ) );
887 double dx = aim.x - pos().x;
888 double dy = aim.y - pos().y;
889 double new_angle = atan2( dy, dx ) + angle_offset;
890 // Always using trig here, rotations in maximum metric are weird
891 double length = trig_dist( pos(), aim );
892 rl_vec3d vec_pos( pos() );
893 rl_vec3d new_aim = vec_pos + rl_vec3d( length, 0, 0 ).rotated( new_angle );
894 ranged::execute_shaped_attack( *shape->create( vec_pos, new_aim ), projectile, *this );
895 }
896 curshot++;
897
898 make_gun_sound_effect( *this, shots > 1, &gun );
899 sfx::generate_gun_sound( *this, gun );
900
901 cycle_action( gun, pos() );
902
903 if( has_trait( trait_PYROMANIA ) && !has_morale( MORALE_PYROMANIA_STARTFIRE ) ) {
904 if( gun.has_flag( flag_PYROMANIAC_WEAPON ) ) {
905 add_msg_if_player( m_good, _( "You feel a surge of euphoria as flames roar out of the %s!" ),
906 gun.tname() );
907 add_morale( MORALE_PYROMANIA_STARTFIRE, 15, 15, 8_hours, 6_hours );
908 rem_morale( MORALE_PYROMANIA_NOFIRE );
909 }
910 }
911
912 if( gun.ammo_consume( gun.ammo_required(), pos() ) != gun.ammo_required() ) {
913 debugmsg( "Unexpected shortage of ammo whilst firing %s", gun.tname() );
914 break;
915 }
916
917 if( !gun.has_flag( flag_VEHICLE ) ) {
918 use_charges( itype_UPS, gun.get_gun_ups_drain() );
919 }
920
921 if( aoe_attack ) {
922 continue; // skip retargeting for launchers
923 }
924 }
925
926 if( gun.has_flag( flag_RELOAD_AND_SHOOT ) ) {
927 // Reset aim for bows and other reload-and-shoot weapons.
928 recoil = MAX_RECOIL;
929 } else {
930 // Now actually apply recoil for the future shots
931 // But only for one shot, because bursts kinda suck
932 int gun_recoil = gun.gun_recoil( can_use_bipod( g->m, pos() ) );
933
934 // If user is currently able to fire a mounted gun freely, penalize recoil based on size class.
935 if( gun.has_flag( flag_MOUNTED_GUN ) && !can_use_bipod( g->m, pos() ) ) {
936 if( get_size() == MS_HUGE ) {
937 gun_recoil = gun_recoil * 2;
938 } else {
939 gun_recoil = gun_recoil * 3;
940 }
941 }
942
943 recoil += gun_recoil;
944 if( is_mech_weapon ) {
945 // mechs can handle recoil far better. they are built around their main gun.
946 recoil = recoil / 2;
947 }
948 recoil = std::min( MAX_RECOIL, recoil );
949 }
950
951 // Use different amounts of time depending on the type of gun and our skill
952 moves -= time_to_attack( *this, *gun.type );
953
954 // Practice the base gun skill proportionally to number of hits, but always by one.
955 practice( skill_gun, ( hits + 1 ) * 5 );
956 // launchers train weapon skill for both hits and misses.
957 int practice_units = aoe_attack ? curshot : hits;
958 practice( gun.gun_skill(), ( practice_units + 1 ) * 5 );
959
960 return curshot;
961}
962
963namespace ranged
964{
965
966int throw_cost( const player &c, const item &to_throw )
967{
968 // Very similar to player::attack_cost
969 // TODO: Extract into a function?
970 // Differences:
971 // Dex is more (2x) important for throwing speed
972 // At 10 skill, the cost is down to 0.75%, not 0.66%
973 const int base_move_cost = to_throw.attack_cost() / 2;
974 const int throw_skill = std::min( MAX_SKILL, c.get_skill_level( skill_throw ) );
975 ///\EFFECT_THROW increases throwing speed
976 const int skill_cost = static_cast<int>( ( base_move_cost * ( 20 - throw_skill ) / 20 ) );
977 ///\EFFECT_DEX increases throwing speed
978 const int dexbonus = c.get_dex();
979 const int encumbrance_penalty = c.encumb( bp_torso ) +
980 ( c.encumb( bp_hand_l ) + c.encumb( bp_hand_r ) ) / 2;
981 const float stamina_ratio = static_cast<float>( c.get_stamina() ) / c.get_stamina_max();
982 const float stamina_penalty = 1.0 + std::max( ( 0.25f - stamina_ratio ) * 4.0f, 0.0f );
983
984 int move_cost = base_move_cost;
985 // Stamina penalty only affects base/2 and encumbrance parts of the cost
986 move_cost += encumbrance_penalty;
987 move_cost *= stamina_penalty;
988 move_cost += skill_cost;
989 move_cost -= dexbonus;
990 move_cost *= c.mutation_value( "attackcost_modifier" );
991
992 return std::max( 25, move_cost );
993}
994
995float get_str_draw_penalty( const item &it, const Character &p )
996{
997 // We only care if weapon has STR_DRAW, and that the user is weaker than required strength.
998 // Also avoid dividing by zero, and skip if we'd just get a result of 1 anyway.
999 if( !it.has_flag( flag_STR_DRAW ) || p.get_str() >= it.get_min_str() || it.get_min_str() <= 1 ) {
1000 return 1.0f;
1001 }
1002 // We also don't want to actually reduce values to zero, even if user is debuffed to zero strength.
1003 float archer_str = std::max( 1, p.get_str() );
1004 return ( archer_str / it.get_min_str() );
1005}
1006
1007float str_draw_damage_modifier( const item &it, const Character &p )
1008{
1009 if( !it.has_flag( flag_STR_DRAW ) || p.get_str() >= it.get_min_str() || it.get_min_str() <= 1 ) {
1010 return 1.0f;
1011 }
1012 if( ranged::get_str_draw_penalty( it, p ) < 0.75f ) {
1013 return 0.5f;
1014 } else if( ranged::get_str_draw_penalty( it, p ) < 1.0f ) {
1015 return 0.75f;
1016 } else {
1017 return 1.0f;
1018 }
1019}
1020
1021float str_draw_dispersion_modifier( const item &it, const Character &p )
1022{
1023 if( !it.has_flag( flag_STR_DRAW ) || p.get_str() >= it.get_min_str() || it.get_min_str() <= 1 ) {
1024 return 1.0f;
1025 }
1026 if( ranged::get_str_draw_penalty( it, p ) < 0.75f ) {
1027 return 0.5f;
1028 } else {
1029 return 1.0f;
1030 }
1031}
1032
1033float str_draw_range_modifier( const item &it, const Character &p )
1034{
1035 if( !it.has_flag( flag_STR_DRAW ) || p.get_str() >= it.get_min_str() || it.get_min_str() <= 1 ) {
1036 return 1.0f;
1037 }
1038 if( ranged::get_str_draw_penalty( it, p ) < 0.75f ) {
1039 return 0.5f;
1040 } else if( ranged::get_str_draw_penalty( it, p ) < 1.0f ) {
1041 return 0.75f;
1042 } else {
1043 return 1.0f;
1044 }
1045}
1046
1047int throw_dispersion_per_dodge( const Character &c, bool add_encumbrance )
1048{
1049 // +200 per dodge point at 0 dexterity
1050 // +100 at 8, +80 at 12, +66.6 at 16, +57 at 20, +50 at 24
1051 // Each 10 encumbrance on either hand is like -1 dex (can bring penalty to +400 per dodge)
1052 // Maybe TODO: Only use one hand
1053 const int encumbrance = add_encumbrance ? c.encumb( bp_hand_l ) + c.encumb( bp_hand_r ) : 0;
1054 ///\EFFECT_DEX increases throwing accuracy against targets with good dodge stat
1055 float effective_dex = 2 + c.get_dex() / 4.0f - ( encumbrance ) / 40.0f;
1056 return static_cast<int>( 100.0f / std::max( 1.0f, effective_dex ) );
1057}
1058
1059// Perfect situation gives us 1000 dispersion at lvl 0
1060// This goes down linearly to 200 dispersion at lvl 10
1061int throwing_dispersion( const Character &c, const item &to_throw, Creature *critter,
1062 bool is_blind_throw )
1063{
1064 units::mass weight = to_throw.weight();
1065 units::volume volume = to_throw.volume();
1066 if( to_throw.count_by_charges() && to_throw.charges > 1 ) {
1067 weight /= to_throw.charges;
1068 volume /= to_throw.charges;
1069 }
1070
1071 int throw_difficulty = 1000;
1072 // 1000 penalty for every liter after the first
1073 // TODO: Except javelin type items
1074 throw_difficulty += std::max<int>( 0, units::to_milliliter( volume - 1_liter ) );
1075 // 1 penalty for gram above str*100 grams (at 0 skill)
1076 ///\EFFECT_STR decreases throwing dispersion when throwing heavy objects
1077 const int weight_in_gram = units::to_gram( weight );
1078 throw_difficulty += std::max( 0, weight_in_gram - c.get_str() * 100 );
1079
1080 // Dispersion from difficult throws goes from 100% at lvl 0 to 20% at lvl 10
1081 ///\EFFECT_THROW increases throwing accuracy
1082 const int throw_skill = std::min( MAX_SKILL, c.get_skill_level( skill_throw ) );
1083 int dispersion = 10 * throw_difficulty / ( 6 * throw_skill + 20 );
1084 // If the target is a creature, it moves around and ruins aim
1085 // TODO: Inform projectile functions if the attacker actually aims for the critter or just the tile
1086 if( critter != nullptr ) {
1087 // It's easier to dodge at close range (thrower needs to adjust more)
1088 // Dodge x10 at point blank, x5 at 1 dist, then flat
1089 float effective_dodge = critter->get_dodge() * std::max( 1, 10 - 5 * rl_dist( c.pos(),
1090 critter->pos() ) );
1091 dispersion += throw_dispersion_per_dodge( c, true ) * effective_dodge;
1092 }
1093 // 1 perception per 1 eye encumbrance
1094 ///\EFFECT_PER decreases throwing accuracy penalty from eye encumbrance
1095 dispersion += std::max( 0, ( c.encumb( bp_eyes ) - c.get_per() ) * 10 );
1096
1097 // If throwing blind, we're assuming they mechanically can't achieve the
1098 // accuracy of a normal throw.
1099 if( is_blind_throw ) {
1100 dispersion *= 4;
1101 }
1102
1103 return std::max( 0, dispersion );
1104}
1105
1106} // namespace ranged
1107
1108dealt_projectile_attack player::throw_item( const tripoint &target, const item &to_throw,
1109 const cata::optional<tripoint> &blind_throw_from_pos )
1110{
1111 // Copy the item, we may alter it before throwing
1112 item thrown = to_throw;
1113
1114 const int move_cost = ranged::throw_cost( *this, to_throw );
1115 mod_moves( -move_cost );
1116
1117 const int throwing_skill = get_skill_level( skill_throw );
1118 units::volume volume = to_throw.volume();
1119 units::mass weight = to_throw.weight();
1120
1121 // Previously calculated as 2_gram * std::max( 1, str_cur )
1122 // using 16_gram normalizes it to 8 str. Same effort expenditure
1123 // for being able to throw farther.
1124 const int weight_cost = weight / ( 16_gram );
1125 const int encumbrance_cost = roll_remainder( ( encumb( bp_arm_l ) + encumb( bp_arm_r ) ) * 2.0f );
1126 const int stamina_cost = ( weight_cost + encumbrance_cost - throwing_skill + 50 ) * -1;
1127
1128 bool throw_assist = false;
1129 int throw_assist_str = 0;
1130 if( is_mounted() ) {
1131 auto mons = mounted_creature.get();
1132 if( mons->mech_str_addition() != 0 ) {
1133 throw_assist = true;
1134 throw_assist_str = mons->mech_str_addition();
1135 mons->use_mech_power( -3 );
1136 }
1137 }
1138 if( !throw_assist ) {
1139 mod_stamina( stamina_cost );
1140 }
1141
1142 const skill_id &skill_used = skill_throw;
1143 int skill_level = std::min( MAX_SKILL, get_skill_level( skill_throw ) );
1144 // if you are lying on the floor, you can't really throw that well
1145 if( has_effect( effect_downed ) ) {
1146 skill_level = std::max( 0, skill_level - 5 );
1147 }
1148 // We'll be constructing a projectile
1149 projectile proj;
1150 proj.impact = thrown.base_damage_thrown();
1151 proj.speed = 10 + skill_level;
1152 auto &impact = proj.impact;
1153
1154 static const std::set<material_id> ferric = { material_id( "iron" ), material_id( "steel" ) };
1155
1156 bool do_railgun = has_active_bionic( bio_railgun ) && thrown.made_of_any( ferric ) &&
1157 !throw_assist;
1158
1159 // The damage dealt due to item's weight, player's strength, and skill level
1160 // Up to str/2 or weight/100g (lower), so 10 str is 5 damage before multipliers
1161 // Railgun doubles the effective strength
1162 ///\EFFECT_STR increases throwing damage
1163 double stats_mod = do_railgun ? get_str() : ( get_str() / 2.0 );
1164 stats_mod = throw_assist ? throw_assist_str / 2.0 : stats_mod;
1165 // modify strength impact based on skill level, clamped to [0.15 - 1]
1166 // mod = mod * [ ( ( skill / max_skill ) * 0.85 ) + 0.15 ]
1167 stats_mod *= ( std::min( MAX_SKILL,
1168 get_skill_level( skill_throw ) ) /
1169 static_cast<double>( MAX_SKILL ) ) * 0.85 + 0.15;
1170 impact.add_damage( DT_BASH, std::min( weight / 100.0_gram, stats_mod ) );
1171
1172 if( thrown.has_flag( "ACT_ON_RANGED_HIT" ) ) {
1173 proj.add_effect( ammo_effect_ACT_ON_RANGED_HIT );
1174 thrown.active = true;
1175 }
1176
1177 // Item will shatter upon landing, destroying the item, dealing damage, and making noise
1178 /** @EFFECT_STR increases chance of shattering thrown glass items (NEGATIVE) */
1179 const bool shatter = !thrown.active && thrown.made_of( material_id( "glass" ) ) &&
1180 rng( 0, units::to_milliliter( 2_liter - volume ) ) < get_str() * 100;
1181
1182 // Item will burst upon landing, destroying the item, and spilling its contents
1183 const bool burst = thrown.has_property( "burst_when_filled" ) && thrown.is_container() &&
1184 thrown.get_property_int64_t( "burst_when_filled" ) <= static_cast<double>
1185 ( thrown.get_contained().volume().value() ) / thrown.get_container_capacity().value() * 100;
1186
1187 // Add some flags to the projectile
1188 if( weight > 500_gram ) {
1189 proj.add_effect( ammo_effect_HEAVY_HIT );
1190 }
1191
1192 proj.add_effect( ammo_effect_NO_ITEM_DAMAGE );
1193
1194 if( thrown.active ) {
1195 // Can't have Molotovs embed into monsters
1196 // Monsters don't have inventory processing
1197 proj.add_effect( ammo_effect_NO_EMBED );
1198 }
1199
1200 if( do_railgun ) {
1201 proj.add_effect( ammo_effect_LIGHTNING );
1202 }
1203
1204 if( volume > 500_ml ) {
1205 proj.add_effect( ammo_effect_WIDE );
1206 }
1207
1208 // Deal extra cut damage if the item breaks
1209 if( shatter ) {
1210 impact.add_damage( DT_CUT, units::to_milliliter( volume ) / 500.0f );
1211 proj.add_effect( ammo_effect_SHATTER_SELF );
1212 }
1213
1214 // TODO: Add wet effect if other things care about that
1215 if( burst ) {
1216 proj.add_effect( ammo_effect_BURST );
1217 }
1218
1219 // Some minor (skill/2) armor piercing for skillful throws
1220 // Not as much as in melee, though
1221 for( damage_unit &du : impact.damage_units ) {
1222 du.res_pen += skill_level / 2.0f;
1223 }
1224 // handling for tangling thrown items
1225 if( thrown.has_flag( "TANGLE" ) ) {
1226 proj.add_effect( ammo_effect_TANGLE );
1227 }
1228
1229 Creature *critter = g->critter_at( target, true );
1230 const dispersion_sources dispersion( ranged::throwing_dispersion( *this, thrown, critter,
1231 blind_throw_from_pos.has_value() ) );
1232 const itype *thrown_type = thrown.type;
1233
1234 // Put the item into the projectile
1235 proj.set_drop( std::move( thrown ) );
1236 if( thrown_type->has_flag( "CUSTOM_EXPLOSION" ) ) {
1237 proj.set_custom_explosion( thrown_type->explosion );
1238 }
1239
1240 // Throw from the player's position, unless we're blind throwing, in which case
1241 // throw from the the blind throw position instead.
1242 const tripoint throw_from = blind_throw_from_pos ? *blind_throw_from_pos : pos();
1243
1244 float range = rl_dist( throw_from, target );
1245 proj.range = range;
1246 int skill_lvl = get_skill_level( skill_used );
1247 // Avoid awarding tons of xp for lucky throws against hard to hit targets
1248 const float range_factor = std::min<float>( range, skill_lvl + 3 );
1249 // We're aiming to get a damaging hit, not just an accurate one - reward proper weapons
1250 const float damage_factor = 5.0f * std::sqrt( proj.impact.total_damage() / 5.0f );
1251 // This should generally have values below ~20*sqrt(skill_lvl)
1252 const float final_xp_mult = range_factor * damage_factor;
1253
1254 auto dealt_attack = projectile_attack( proj, throw_from, target, dispersion, this );
1255
1256 const double missed_by = dealt_attack.missed_by;
1257 if( missed_by <= 0.1 && dealt_attack.hit_critter != nullptr ) {
1258 practice( skill_used, final_xp_mult, MAX_SKILL );
1259 // TODO: Check target for existence of head
1260 g->events().send<event_type::character_gets_headshot>( getID() );
1261 } else if( dealt_attack.hit_critter != nullptr && missed_by > 0.0f ) {
1262 practice( skill_used, final_xp_mult / ( 1.0f + missed_by ), MAX_SKILL );
1263 } else {
1264 // Pure grindy practice - cap gain at lvl 2
1265 practice( skill_used, 5, 2 );
1266 }
1267 // Reset last target pos
1268 last_target_pos = cata::nullopt;
1269 recoil = MAX_RECOIL;
1270
1271 return dealt_attack;
1272}
1273
1274static void do_aim( player &p, const item &relevant, const double min_recoil )
1275{
1276 const double aim_amount = p.aim_per_move( relevant, p.recoil );
1277 if( aim_amount > 0 && p.recoil > min_recoil ) {
1278 // Increase aim at the cost of moves
1279 p.mod_moves( -1 );
1280 p.recoil = std::max( min_recoil, p.recoil - aim_amount );
1281 } else {
1282 // If aim is already maxed, we're just waiting, so pass the turn.
1283 p.set_moves( 0 );
1284 }
1285}
1286
1287struct confidence_rating {
1288 double aim_level;
1289 char symbol;
1290 std::string color;
1291 std::string label;
1292};
1293
1294static int print_steadiness( const catacurses::window &w, int line_number, double steadiness )
1295{
1296 const int window_width = getmaxx( w ) - 2; // Window width minus borders.
1297
1298 if( get_option<std::string>( "ACCURACY_DISPLAY" ) == "numbers" ) {
1299 std::string steadiness_s = string_format( "%s: %d%%", _( "Steadiness" ),
1300 static_cast<int>( 100.0 * steadiness ) );
1301 mvwprintw( w, point( 1, line_number++ ), steadiness_s );
1302 } else {
1303 const std::string &steadiness_bar = get_labeled_bar( steadiness, window_width,
1304 _( "Steadiness" ), '*' );
1305 mvwprintw( w, point( 1, line_number++ ), steadiness_bar );
1306 }
1307
1308 return line_number;
1309}
1310
1311static double confidence_estimate( int range, double target_size,
1312 const dispersion_sources &dispersion )
1313{
1314 // This is a rough estimate of accuracy based on a linear distribution across min and max
1315 // dispersion. It is highly inaccurate probability-wise. The result gives the player
1316 // correct relative measures of chance to hit, and corresponds with the actual distribution at
1317 // min, max, and mean.
1318 if( range == 0 ) {
1319 return 2 * target_size;
1320 }
1321 const double max_lateral_offset =
1322 iso_tangent( range, units::from_arcmin( dispersion.max() ) );
1323 return 1 / ( max_lateral_offset / target_size );
1324}
1325
1326static std::vector<aim_type> get_default_aim_type()
1327{
1328 std::vector<aim_type> aim_types;
1329 aim_types.push_back( aim_type { "", "", "", false, 0 } ); // dummy aim type for unaimed shots
1330 return aim_types;
1331}
1332
1333using RatingVector = std::vector<std::tuple<double, char, std::string>>;
1334static std::string get_colored_bar( const double val, const int width, const std::string &label,
1335 RatingVector::iterator begin, RatingVector::iterator end )
1336{
1337 std::string result;
1338
1339 result.reserve( width );
1340 if( !label.empty() ) {
1341 result += label;
1342 result += ' ';
1343 }
1344 const int bar_width = width - utf8_width( result ) - 2; // - 2 for the brackets
1345
1346 result += '[';
1347 if( bar_width > 0 ) {
1348 int used_width = 0;
1349 for( auto it( begin ); it != end; ++it ) {
1350 const double factor = std::min( 1.0, std::max( 0.0, std::get<0>( *it ) * val ) );
1351 const int seg_width = static_cast<int>( factor * bar_width ) - used_width;
1352
1353 if( seg_width <= 0 ) {
1354 continue;
1355 }
1356 used_width += seg_width;
1357 result += string_format( "<color_%s>", std::get<2>( *it ) );
1358 result.insert( result.end(), seg_width, std::get<1>( *it ) );
1359 result += "</color>";
1360 }
1361 result.insert( result.end(), bar_width - used_width, ' ' );
1362 }
1363 result += ']';
1364
1365 return result;
1366}
1367
1368static int print_ranged_chance( const player &, const catacurses::window &w, int line_number,
1369 input_context &ctxt, const item &,
1370 const std::vector<aim_type> &aim_types,
1371 const std::function<dispersion_sources( const aim_type & )> &dispersion_fun,
1372 const std::function<int( const aim_type & )> &cost_fun,
1373 const std::vector<confidence_rating> &confidence_config,
1374 double range, double target_size )
1375{
1376 int window_width = getmaxx( w ) - 2; // Window width minus borders.
1377 std::string display_type = get_option<std::string>( "ACCURACY_DISPLAY" );
1378 std::string panel_type = panel_manager::get_manager().get_current_layout_id();
1379 const int bars_pad = 3; // Padding for "bars" to fit moves_to_fire value.
1380 if( ( panel_type == "compact" || panel_type == "labels-narrow" ) && display_type != "numbers" ) {
1381 window_width -= bars_pad;
1382 }
1383
1384 std::string label_m = _( "Moves" );
1385 std::vector<std::string> t_aims( 4 ), t_confidence( 16 );
1386 int aim_iter = 0, conf_iter = 0;
1387
1388 nc_color col = c_dark_gray;
1389
1390 if( display_type != "numbers" ) {
1391 std::string symbols;
1392 int column_number = 1;
1393 if( !( panel_type == "compact" || panel_type == "labels-narrow" ) ) {
1394 std::string label = _( "Symbols:" );
1395 mvwprintw( w, point( column_number, line_number ), label );
1396 column_number += utf8_width( label ) + 1; // 1 for whitespace after 'Symbols:'
1397 }
1398 for( const confidence_rating &cr : confidence_config ) {
1399 std::string label = pgettext( "aim_confidence", cr.label.c_str() );
1400 std::string symbols = string_format( "<color_%s>%s</color> = %s", cr.color, cr.symbol,
1401 label );
1402 int line_len = utf8_width( label ) + 5; // 5 for '# = ' and whitespace at end
1403 if( ( window_width + bars_pad - column_number ) < line_len ) {
1404 column_number = 1;
1405 line_number++;
1406 }
1407 print_colored_text( w, point( column_number, line_number ), col, col, symbols );
1408 column_number += line_len;
1409 }
1410 line_number++;
1411 }
1412 if( ( panel_type == "compact" || panel_type == "labels-narrow" ) && display_type == "numbers" ) {
1413 std::string symbols = _( " <color_green>Great</color> - <color_light_gray>Normal</color>"
1414 " - <color_magenta>Graze</color> - <color_light_blue>Moves</color>" );
1415 fold_and_print( w, point( 1, line_number++ ), window_width + bars_pad,
1416 c_dark_gray, symbols );
1417 int len = utf8_width( symbols ) - 96; // 96 to subtract color codes
1418 if( len > window_width + bars_pad ) {
1419 line_number++;
1420 }
1421 for( int i = 0; i < window_width; i++ ) {
1422 mvwprintw( w, point( i + 1, line_number ), "-" );
1423 }
1424 }
1425
1426 const auto front_or = [&]( const std::string & s, const char fallback ) {
1427 const auto keys = ctxt.keys_bound_to( s );
1428 return keys.empty() ? fallback : keys.front();
1429 };
1430
1431 for( const aim_type &type : aim_types ) {
1432 dispersion_sources current_dispersion = dispersion_fun( type );
1433 std::string label = _( "Current" );
1434 std::string aim_l = _( "Aim" );
1435 if( type.has_threshold ) {
1436 label = type.name;
1437 }
1438
1439 int moves_to_fire = cost_fun( type );
1440
1441 auto hotkey = front_or( type.action.empty() ? "FIRE" : type.action, ' ' );
1442 if( ( panel_type == "compact" || panel_type == "labels-narrow" ) ) {
1443 if( display_type == "numbers" ) {
1444 t_aims[aim_iter] = string_format( "<color_dark_gray>%s:</color>", label );
1445 t_confidence[( aim_iter * 4 ) + 3] = string_format( "<color_light_blue>%d</color>", moves_to_fire );
1446 } else {
1447 print_colored_text( w, point( 1, line_number ), col, col, string_format( _( "%s %s:" ), label,
1448 aim_l ) );
1449 right_print( w, line_number++, 1, c_light_blue, _( "Moves" ) );
1450 right_print( w, line_number, 1, c_light_blue, string_format( "%d", moves_to_fire ) );
1451 }
1452 } else {
1453 print_colored_text( w, point( 1, line_number++ ), col, col,
1454 string_format( _( "<color_white>[%s]</color> %s %s: Moves to fire: "
1455 "<color_light_blue>%d</color>" ),
1456 hotkey, label, aim_l, moves_to_fire ) );
1457 }
1458
1459 double confidence = confidence_estimate( range, target_size, current_dispersion );
1460
1461 if( display_type == "numbers" ) {
1462 if( panel_type == "compact" || panel_type == "labels-narrow" ) {
1463 int last_chance = 0;
1464 for( const confidence_rating &cr : confidence_config ) {
1465 int chance = std::min<int>( 100, 100.0 * ( cr.aim_level ) * confidence ) - last_chance;
1466 last_chance += chance;
1467 t_confidence[conf_iter] = string_format( "<color_%s>%3d%%</color>", cr.color, chance );
1468 conf_iter++;
1469 if( conf_iter == ( aim_iter * 4 ) + 3 ) {
1470 conf_iter++;
1471 }
1472 }
1473 aim_iter++;
1474 } else {
1475 int last_chance = 0;
1476 std::string confidence_s = enumerate_as_string( confidence_config.begin(), confidence_config.end(),
1477 [&]( const confidence_rating & config ) {
1478 // TODO: Consider not printing 0 chances, but only if you can print something (at least miss 100% or so)
1479 int chance = std::min<int>( 100, 100.0 * ( config.aim_level * confidence ) ) - last_chance;
1480 last_chance += chance;
1481 return string_format( "%s: <color_%s>%3d%%</color>", pgettext( "aim_confidence",
1482 config.label.c_str() ), config.color, chance );
1483 }, enumeration_conjunction::none );
1484 line_number += fold_and_print_from( w, point( 1, line_number ), window_width, 0,
1485 c_dark_gray, confidence_s );
1486 }
1487 } else {
1488 std::vector<std::tuple<double, char, std::string>> confidence_ratings;
1489 std::transform( confidence_config.begin(), confidence_config.end(),
1490 std::back_inserter( confidence_ratings ),
1491 [&]( const confidence_rating & config ) {
1492 return std::make_tuple( config.aim_level, config.symbol, config.color );
1493 }
1494 );
1495 const std::string &confidence_bar = get_colored_bar( confidence, window_width, "",
1496 confidence_ratings.begin(),
1497 confidence_ratings.end() );
1498
1499 print_colored_text( w, point( 1, line_number++ ), col, col, confidence_bar );
1500 }
1501 }
1502
1503 // Draw tables for compact Numbers display
1504 if( ( panel_type == "compact" || panel_type == "labels-narrow" )
1505 && display_type == "numbers" ) {
1506 const std::string divider = "|";
1507 int left_pad = 10, columns = 4;
1508 insert_table( w, left_pad, ++line_number, columns, c_light_gray, divider, true, t_confidence );
1509 insert_table( w, 0, line_number, 1, c_light_gray, "", false, t_aims );
1510 line_number = line_number + 4; // 4 to account for the tables
1511 }
1512 return line_number;
1513}
1514
1515// Whether player character knows creature's position and can roughly track it with the aim cursor
1516static bool pl_sees( const Creature &cr )
1517{
1518 Character &u = get_player_character();
1519 return u.sees( cr ) || u.sees_with_infrared( cr ) || u.sees_with_specials( cr );
1520}
1521
1522// Handle capping aim level when the player cannot see the target tile or there is nothing to aim at.
1523static double calculate_aim_cap( const player &p, const tripoint &target )
1524{
1525 double min_recoil = 0.0;
1526 const Creature *victim = g->critter_at( target, true );
1527 // No p.sees_with_specials() here because special senses are not precise enough
1528 // to give creature's exact size & position, only which tile it occupies
1529 if( victim == nullptr || ( !p.sees( *victim ) && !p.sees_with_infrared( *victim ) ) ) {
1530 const int range = rl_dist( p.pos(), target );
1531 // Get angle of triangle that spans the target square.
1532 const double angle = atan2( 1, range );
1533 // Convert from radians to arcmin.
1534 min_recoil = 60 * 180 * angle / M_PI;
1535 }
1536 return min_recoil;
1537}
1538
1539static int print_aim( const player &p, const catacurses::window &w, int line_number,
1540 input_context &ctxt, const item &weapon,
1541 const double target_size, const tripoint &pos, double predicted_recoil )
1542{
1543 // This is absolute accuracy for the player.
1544 // TODO: push the calculations duplicated from Creature::deal_projectile_attack() and
1545 // Creature::projectile_attack() into shared methods.
1546 // Dodge doesn't affect gun attacks
1547
1548 dispersion_sources dispersion = p.get_weapon_dispersion( weapon );
1549 dispersion.add_range( p.recoil_vehicle() );
1550
1551 const double min_recoil = calculate_aim_cap( p, pos );
1552 const double effective_recoil = p.effective_dispersion( p.weapon.sight_dispersion() );
1553 const double min_dispersion = std::max( min_recoil, effective_recoil );
1554 const double steadiness_range = MAX_RECOIL - min_dispersion;
1555 // This is a relative measure of how steady the player's aim is,
1556 // 0 is the best the player can do.
1557 const double steady_score = std::max( 0.0, predicted_recoil - min_dispersion );
1558 // Fairly arbitrary cap on steadiness...
1559 const double steadiness = 1.0 - ( steady_score / steadiness_range );
1560
1561 // This could be extracted, to allow more/less verbose displays
1562 static const std::vector<confidence_rating> confidence_config = {{
1563 { accuracy_critical, '*', "green", translate_marker_context( "aim_confidence", "Great" ) },
1564 { accuracy_standard, '+', "light_gray", translate_marker_context( "aim_confidence", "Normal" ) },
1565 { accuracy_grazing, '|', "magenta", translate_marker_context( "aim_confidence", "Graze" ) }
1566 }
1567 };
1568
1569 int shots = std::max( 1, weapon.gun_current_mode().qty );
1570 const auto dispersion_fun = [&]( const aim_type & at ) {
1571 int at_recoil = at.has_threshold ? at.threshold : static_cast<int>( predicted_recoil );
1572 return calculate_dispersion( g->m, p, weapon, at_recoil, shots > 1 );
1573 };
1574 const auto cost_fun = [&]( const aim_type & at ) {
1575 int at_recoil = at.has_threshold ? at.threshold : static_cast<int>( predicted_recoil );
1576 return p.gun_engagement_moves( weapon, at_recoil, p.recoil ) + time_to_attack( p,
1577 *weapon.type );
1578 };
1579 const double range = rl_dist( p.pos(), pos );
1580 line_number = print_steadiness( w, line_number, steadiness );
1581 return print_ranged_chance( p, w, line_number, ctxt, weapon, p.get_aim_types( weapon ),
1582 dispersion_fun, cost_fun,
1583 confidence_config,
1584 range, target_size );
1585}
1586
1587static int draw_throw_aim( const player &p, const catacurses::window &w, int line_number,
1588 input_context &ctxt,
1589 const item &weapon, const tripoint &target_pos, bool is_blind_throw )
1590{
1591 Creature *target = g->critter_at( target_pos, true );
1592 if( target != nullptr && !p.sees( *target ) ) {
1593 target = nullptr;
1594 }
1595
1596 const dispersion_sources dispersion(
1597 ranged::throwing_dispersion( p, weapon, target, is_blind_throw ) );
1598 const double range = rl_dist( p.pos(), target_pos );
1599
1600 const double target_size = target != nullptr ? target->ranged_target_size() : 1.0f;
1601
1602 static const std::vector<confidence_rating> confidence_config_critter = {{
1603 { accuracy_critical, '*', "green", translate_marker_context( "aim_confidence", "Great" ) },
1604 { accuracy_standard, '+', "light_gray", translate_marker_context( "aim_confidence", "Normal" ) },
1605 { accuracy_grazing, '|', "magenta", translate_marker_context( "aim_confidence", "Graze" ) }
1606 }
1607 };
1608 static const std::vector<confidence_rating> confidence_config_object = {{
1609 { accuracy_grazing, '*', "white", translate_marker_context( "aim_confidence", "Hit" ) }
1610 }
1611 };
1612 const auto &confidence_config = target != nullptr ?
1613 confidence_config_critter : confidence_config_object;
1614
1615 const auto dispersion_fun = [&]( const aim_type & ) {
1616 return dispersion;
1617 };
1618 const auto cost_fun = [&]( const aim_type & ) {
1619 return ranged::throw_cost( p, weapon );
1620 };
1621 return print_ranged_chance( p, w, line_number, ctxt, weapon, get_default_aim_type(),
1622 dispersion_fun, cost_fun,
1623 confidence_config,
1624 range, target_size );
1625}
1626
1627std::vector<aim_type> Character::get_aim_types( const item &gun ) const
1628{
1629 std::vector<aim_type> aim_types = get_default_aim_type();
1630 if( !gun.is_gun() ) {
1631 return aim_types;
1632 }
1633 int sight_dispersion = effective_dispersion( gun.sight_dispersion() );
1634 // Aiming thresholds are dependent on weapon sight dispersion, attempting to place thresholds
1635 // at 10%, 5% and 0% of the difference between MAX_RECOIL and sight dispersion.
1636 std::vector<int> thresholds = {
1637 static_cast<int>( ( ( MAX_RECOIL - sight_dispersion ) / 10.0 ) + sight_dispersion ),
1638 static_cast<int>( ( ( MAX_RECOIL - sight_dispersion ) / 20.0 ) + sight_dispersion ),
1639 static_cast<int>( sight_dispersion )
1640 };
1641 // Remove duplicate thresholds.
1642 std::vector<int>::iterator thresholds_it = std::adjacent_find( thresholds.begin(),
1643 thresholds.end() );
1644 while( thresholds_it != thresholds.end() ) {
1645 thresholds.erase( thresholds_it );
1646 thresholds_it = std::adjacent_find( thresholds.begin(), thresholds.end() );
1647 }
1648 thresholds_it = thresholds.begin();
1649 aim_types.push_back( aim_type { _( "Regular" ), "AIMED_SHOT", _( "[%c] to aim and fire." ),
1650 true, *thresholds_it } );
1651 thresholds_it++;
1652 if( thresholds_it != thresholds.end() ) {
1653 aim_types.push_back( aim_type { _( "Careful" ), "CAREFUL_SHOT",
1654 _( "[%c] to take careful aim and fire." ), true,
1655 *thresholds_it } );
1656 thresholds_it++;
1657 }
1658 if( thresholds_it != thresholds.end() ) {
1659 aim_types.push_back( aim_type { _( "Precise" ), "PRECISE_SHOT",
1660 _( "[%c] to take precise aim and fire." ), true,
1661 *thresholds_it } );
1662 }
1663 return aim_types;
1664}
1665
1666static projectile make_gun_projectile( const item &gun )
1667{
1668 projectile proj;
1669 proj.speed = 1000;
1670 proj.impact = gun.gun_damage();
1671 proj.range = gun.gun_range();
1672 for( const ammo_effect_str_id &ae_id : gun.ammo_effects() ) {
1673 proj.add_effect( ae_id );
1674 }
1675
1676 auto &fx = proj;
1677
1678 if( ( gun.ammo_data() && gun.ammo_data()->phase == LIQUID ) ||
1679 fx.has_effect( ammo_effect_SHOT ) || fx.has_effect( ammo_effect_BOUNCE ) ) {
1680 fx.add_effect( ammo_effect_WIDE );
1681 }
1682
1683 if( gun.ammo_data() ) {
1684 assert( gun.ammo_data()->ammo );
1685 const islot_ammo &ammo = *gun.ammo_data()->ammo;
1686 // Some projectiles have a chance of being recoverable
1687 bool recover = !one_in( ammo.dont_recover_one_in );
1688
1689 if( recover && !fx.has_effect( ammo_effect_IGNITE ) && !fx.has_effect( ammo_effect_EXPLOSIVE ) ) {
1690 item drop( gun.ammo_current(), calendar::turn, 1 );
1691 drop.active = fx.has_effect( ammo_effect_ACT_ON_RANGED_HIT );
1692 proj.set_drop( drop );
1693 }
1694
1695 if( ammo.drop ) {
1696 item drop( ammo.drop );
1697 if( ammo.drop_active ) {
1698 drop.activate();
1699 }
1700 proj.set_drop( drop );
1701 }
1702
1703 if( fx.has_effect( ammo_effect_CUSTOM_EXPLOSION ) ) {
1704 proj.set_custom_explosion( gun.ammo_data()->explosion );
1705 }
1706 }
1707
1708 return proj;
1709}
1710
1711int time_to_attack( const Character &p, const itype &firing )
1712{
1713 const skill_id &skill_used = firing.gun->skill_used;
1714 const time_info_t &info = skill_used->time_to_attack();
1715 return std::max( info.min_time,
1716 info.base_time - info.time_reduction_per_level * p.get_skill_level( skill_used ) );
1717}
1718
1719static void cycle_action( item &weap, const tripoint &pos )
1720{
1721 // eject casings and linkages in random direction avoiding walls using player position as fallback
1722 std::vector<tripoint> tiles = closest_points_first( pos, 1 );
1723 tiles.erase( tiles.begin() );
1724 tiles.erase( std::remove_if( tiles.begin(), tiles.end(), [&]( const tripoint & e ) {
1725 return !g->m.passable( e );
1726 } ), tiles.end() );
1727 tripoint eject = tiles.empty() ? pos : random_entry( tiles );
1728
1729 // for turrets try and drop casings or linkages directly to any CARGO part on the same tile
1730 const optional_vpart_position vp = g->m.veh_at( pos );
1731 std::vector<vehicle_part *> cargo;
1732 if( vp && weap.has_flag( "VEHICLE" ) ) {
1733 cargo = vp->vehicle().get_parts_at( pos, "CARGO", part_status_flag::any );
1734 }
1735
1736 if( weap.ammo_data() && weap.ammo_data()->ammo->casing ) {
1737 const itype_id casing = *weap.ammo_data()->ammo->casing;
1738 if( weap.has_flag( "RELOAD_EJECT" ) || weap.gunmod_find( itype_brass_catcher ) ) {
1739 weap.put_in( item( casing ).set_flag( "CASING" ) );
1740 } else {
1741 if( cargo.empty() ) {
1742 g->m.add_item_or_charges( eject, item( casing ) );
1743 } else {
1744 vp->vehicle().add_item( *cargo.front(), item( casing ) );
1745 }
1746
1747 sfx::play_variant_sound( "fire_gun", "brass_eject", sfx::get_heard_volume( eject ),
1748 sfx::get_heard_angle( eject ) );
1749 }
1750 }
1751
1752 // some magazines also eject disintegrating linkages
1753 const auto mag = weap.magazine_current();
1754 if( mag && mag->type->magazine->linkage ) {
1755 item linkage( *mag->type->magazine->linkage, calendar::turn, 1 );
1756 if( weap.gunmod_find( itype_brass_catcher ) ) {
1757 linkage.set_flag( "CASING" );
1758 weap.put_in( linkage );
1759 } else if( cargo.empty() ) {
1760 g->m.add_item_or_charges( eject, linkage );
1761 } else {
1762 vp->vehicle().add_item( *cargo.front(), linkage );
1763 }
1764 }
1765}
1766
1767void make_gun_sound_effect( const player &p, bool burst, item *weapon )
1768{
1769 const auto data = weapon->gun_noise( burst );
1770 if( data.volume > 0 ) {
1771 sounds::sound( p.pos(), data.volume, sounds::sound_t::combat,
1772 data.sound.empty() ? _( "Bang!" ) : data.sound );
1773 }
1774}
1775
1776item::sound_data item::gun_noise( const bool burst ) const
1777{
1778 if( !is_gun() ) {
1779 return { 0, "" };
1780 }
1781
1782 int noise = type->gun->loudness;
1783 for( const auto mod : gunmods() ) {
1784 noise += mod->type->gunmod->loudness;
1785 }
1786 if( ammo_data() ) {
1787 noise += ammo_data()->ammo->loudness;
1788 }
1789
1790 noise = std::max( noise, 0 );
1791
1792 if( ammo_current() == itype_40x46mm || ammo_current() == itype_40x53mm ) {
1793 // Grenade launchers
1794 return { 8, _( "Thunk!" ) };
1795
1796 } else if( ammo_current() == itype_12mm || ammo_current() == itype_metal_rail ) {
1797 // Railguns
1798 return { 24, _( "tz-CRACKck!" ) };
1799
1800 } else if( ammo_current() == itype_flammable || ammo_current() == itype_66mm ||
1801 ammo_current() == itype_84x246mm || ammo_current() == itype_m235 ) {
1802 // Rocket launchers and flamethrowers
1803 return { 4, _( "Fwoosh!" ) };
1804 } else if( ammo_current() == itype_arrow ) {
1805 return { noise, _( "whizz!" ) };
1806 } else if( ammo_current() == itype_bolt ) {
1807 return { noise, _( "thonk!" ) };
1808 }
1809
1810 auto fx = ammo_effects();
1811
1812 if( fx.count( ammo_effect_LASER ) || fx.count( ammo_effect_PLASMA ) ) {
1813 if( noise < 20 ) {
1814 return { noise, _( "Fzzt!" ) };
1815 } else if( noise < 40 ) {
1816 return { noise, _( "Pew!" ) };
1817 } else if( noise < 60 ) {
1818 return { noise, _( "Tsewww!" ) };
1819 } else {
1820 return { noise, _( "Kra-kow!" ) };
1821 }
1822
1823 } else if( fx.count( ammo_effect_LIGHTNING ) ) {
1824 if( noise < 20 ) {
1825 return { noise, _( "Bzzt!" ) };
1826 } else if( noise < 40 ) {
1827 return { noise, _( "Bzap!" ) };
1828 } else if( noise < 60 ) {
1829 return { noise, _( "Bzaapp!" ) };
1830 } else {
1831 return { noise, _( "Kra-koom!" ) };
1832 }
1833
1834 } else if( fx.count( ammo_effect_WHIP ) ) {
1835 return { noise, _( "Crack!" ) };
1836
1837 } else if( noise > 0 ) {
1838 if( noise < 10 ) {
1839 return { noise, burst ? _( "Brrrip!" ) : _( "plink!" ) };
1840 } else if( noise < 150 ) {
1841 return { noise, burst ? _( "Brrrap!" ) : _( "bang!" ) };
1842 } else if( noise < 175 ) {
1843 return { noise, burst ? _( "P-p-p-pow!" ) : _( "blam!" ) };
1844 } else {
1845 return { noise, burst ? _( "Kaboom!" ) : _( "kerblam!" ) };
1846 }
1847 }
1848
1849 return { 0, "" }; // silent weapons
1850}
1851
1852static bool is_driving( const player &p )
1853{
1854 const optional_vpart_position vp = g->m.veh_at( p.pos() );
1855 return vp && vp->vehicle().is_moving() && vp->vehicle().player_in_control( p );
1856}
1857
1858static double dispersion_from_skill( double skill, double weapon_dispersion )
1859{
1860 if( skill >= MAX_SKILL ) {
1861 return 0.0;
1862 }
1863 double skill_shortfall = double( MAX_SKILL ) - skill;
1864 double dispersion_penalty = 3 * skill_shortfall;
1865 double skill_threshold = 5;
1866 if( skill >= skill_threshold ) {
1867 double post_threshold_skill_shortfall = double( MAX_SKILL ) - skill;
1868 // Lack of mastery multiplies the dispersion of the weapon.
1869 return dispersion_penalty + ( weapon_dispersion * post_threshold_skill_shortfall * 1.25 ) /
1870 ( double( MAX_SKILL ) - skill_threshold );
1871 }
1872 // Unskilled shooters suffer greater penalties, still scaling with weapon penalties.
1873 double pre_threshold_skill_shortfall = skill_threshold - skill;
1874 dispersion_penalty += weapon_dispersion *
1875 ( 1.25 + pre_threshold_skill_shortfall * 3.75 / skill_threshold );
1876
1877 return dispersion_penalty;
1878}
1879
1880// utility functions for projectile_attack
1881dispersion_sources player::get_weapon_dispersion( const item &obj ) const
1882{
1883 int weapon_dispersion = obj.gun_dispersion();
1884 dispersion_sources dispersion( weapon_dispersion );
1885 dispersion.add_range( ranged_dex_mod() );
1886
1887 dispersion.add_range( ( encumb( bp_arm_l ) + encumb( bp_arm_r ) ) / 5.0 );
1888
1889 if( is_driving( *this ) ) {
1890 // get volume of gun (or for auxiliary gunmods the parent gun)
1891 const item *parent = has_item( obj ) ? find_parent( obj ) : nullptr;
1892 const int vol = ( parent ? parent->volume() : obj.volume() ) / 250_ml;
1893
1894 /** @EFFECT_DRIVING reduces the inaccuracy penalty when using guns whilst driving */
1895 dispersion.add_range( std::max( vol - get_skill_level( skill_driving ), 1 ) * 20 );
1896 }
1897
1898 /** @EFFECT_GUN improves usage of accurate weapons and sights */
1899 double avgSkill = static_cast<double>( get_skill_level( skill_gun ) +
1900 get_skill_level( obj.gun_skill() ) ) / 2.0;
1901 avgSkill = std::min( avgSkill, static_cast<double>( MAX_SKILL ) );
1902
1903 dispersion.add_range( dispersion_from_skill( avgSkill, weapon_dispersion ) );
1904
1905 if( has_bionic( bio_targeting ) ) {
1906 dispersion.add_multiplier( 0.75 );
1907 }
1908
1909 // If using a bow you lack the strength for, increase based on how much weaker shooter is.
1910 dispersion.add_multiplier( 1 / ranged::str_draw_dispersion_modifier( obj, *this ) );
1911
1912 // Range is effectively four times longer when shooting unflagged/flagged guns underwater/out of water.
1913 if( is_underwater() != obj.has_flag( flag_UNDERWATER_GUN ) ) {
1914 // Adding dispersion for additional debuff
1915 dispersion.add_range( 150 );
1916 dispersion.add_multiplier( 4 );
1917 }
1918
1919 // If user is currently able to fire a mounted gun freely, penalize dispersion based on size class.
1920 if( obj.has_flag( flag_MOUNTED_GUN ) && !can_use_bipod( g->m, pos() ) ) {
1921 if( get_size() == MS_HUGE ) {
1922 dispersion.add_multiplier( 2 );
1923 } else {
1924 dispersion.add_multiplier( 3 );
1925 }
1926 }
1927
1928 return dispersion;
1929}
1930
1931double player::gun_value( const item &weap, int ammo ) const
1932{
1933 // TODO: Mods
1934 // TODO: Allow using a specified type of ammo rather than default or current
1935 if( !weap.type->gun ) {
1936 return 0.0;
1937 }
1938
1939 if( ammo <= 0 ) {
1940 return 0.0;
1941 }
1942
1943 const islot_gun &gun = *weap.type->gun;
1944 itype_id ammo_type;
1945 if( !weap.ammo_current().is_null() ) {
1946 ammo_type = weap.ammo_current();
1947 } else if( weap.magazine_current() ) {
1948 ammo_type = weap.common_ammo_default();
1949 } else {
1950 ammo_type = weap.ammo_default();
1951 }
1952 const itype *def_ammo_i = ammo_type.is_null() ? nullptr : &*ammo_type;
1953
1954 damage_instance gun_damage = weap.gun_damage();
1955 item tmp = weap;
1956 tmp.ammo_set( ammo_type );
1957 int total_dispersion = get_weapon_dispersion( tmp ).max() +
1958 effective_dispersion( tmp.sight_dispersion() );
1959
1960 if( def_ammo_i != nullptr && def_ammo_i->ammo ) {
1961 const islot_ammo &def_ammo = *def_ammo_i->ammo;
1962 gun_damage.add( def_ammo.damage );
1963 total_dispersion += def_ammo.dispersion;
1964 }
1965
1966 float damage_factor = gun_damage.total_damage();
1967 if( damage_factor > 0 ) {
1968 // TODO: Multiple damage types
1969 damage_factor += 0.5f * gun_damage.damage_units.front().res_pen;
1970 }
1971
1972 int move_cost = time_to_attack( *this, *weap.type );
1973 if( gun.clip != 0 && gun.clip < 10 ) {
1974 // TODO: RELOAD_ONE should get a penalty here
1975 int reload_cost = gun.reload_time + encumb( bp_hand_l ) + encumb( bp_hand_r );
1976 reload_cost /= gun.clip;
1977 move_cost += reload_cost;
1978 }
1979
1980 // "Medium range" below means 9 tiles, "short range" means 4
1981 // Those are guarantees (assuming maximum time spent aiming)
1982 static const std::vector<std::pair<float, float>> dispersion_thresholds = {{
1983 // Headshots all the time
1984 { 0.0f, 5.0f },
1985 // Critical at medium range
1986 { 100.0f, 4.5f },
1987 // Critical at short range or good hit at medium
1988 { 200.0f, 3.5f },
1989 // OK hits at medium
1990 { 300.0f, 3.0f },
1991 // Point blank headshots
1992 { 450.0f, 2.5f },
1993 // OK hits at short
1994 { 700.0f, 1.5f },
1995 // Glances at medium, criticals at point blank
1996 { 1000.0f, 1.0f },
1997 // Nothing guaranteed, pure gamble
1998 { 2000.0f, 0.1f },
1999 }
2000 };
2001
2002 static const std::vector<std::pair<float, float>> move_cost_thresholds = {{
2003 { 10.0f, 4.0f },
2004 { 25.0f, 3.0f },
2005 { 100.0f, 1.0f },
2006 { 500.0f, 5.0f },
2007 }
2008 };
2009
2010 float move_cost_factor = multi_lerp( move_cost_thresholds, move_cost );
2011
2012 // Penalty for dodging in melee makes the gun unusable in melee
2013 // Until NPCs get proper kiting, at least
2014 int melee_penalty = weapon.volume() / 250_ml - get_skill_level( skill_dodge );
2015 if( melee_penalty <= 0 ) {
2016 // Dispersion matters less if you can just use the gun in melee
2017 total_dispersion = std::min<int>( total_dispersion / move_cost_factor, total_dispersion );
2018 }
2019
2020 float dispersion_factor = multi_lerp( dispersion_thresholds, total_dispersion );
2021
2022 float damage_and_accuracy = damage_factor * dispersion_factor;
2023
2024 // TODO: Some better approximation of the ability to keep on shooting
2025 static const std::vector<std::pair<float, float>> capacity_thresholds = {{
2026 { 1.0f, 0.5f },
2027 { 5.0f, 1.0f },
2028 { 10.0f, 1.5f },
2029 { 20.0f, 2.0f },
2030 { 50.0f, 3.0f },
2031 }
2032 };
2033
2034 // How much until reload
2035 float capacity = gun.clip > 0 ? std::min<float>( gun.clip, ammo ) : ammo;
2036 // How much until dry and a new weapon is needed
2037 capacity += std::min<float>( 1.0, ammo / 20.0 );
2038 double capacity_factor = multi_lerp( capacity_thresholds, capacity );
2039
2040 double gun_value = damage_and_accuracy * capacity_factor;
2041
2042 add_msg( m_debug, "%s as gun: %.1f total, %.1f dispersion, %.1f damage, %.1f capacity",
2043 weap.type->get_id().str(), gun_value, dispersion_factor, damage_factor,
2044 capacity_factor );
2045 return std::max( 0.0, gun_value );
2046}
2047
2048double Character::recoil_vehicle() const
2049{
2050 // TODO: vary penalty dependent upon vehicle part on which player is boarded
2051
2052 if( in_vehicle ) {
2053 if( const optional_vpart_position vp = g->m.veh_at( pos() ) ) {
2054 return static_cast<double>( std::abs( vp->vehicle().velocity ) ) * 3 / 100;
2055 }
2056 }
2057 return 0;
2058}
2059
2060double Character::recoil_total() const
2061{
2062 return recoil + recoil_vehicle();
2063}

2065namespace ranged
2066{
2067
2068std::vector<Creature *> targetable_creatures( const Character &c, const int range )
2069{
2070 return targetable_creatures( c, range, turret_data() );
2071}
2072
2073std::vector<Creature *> targetable_creatures( const Character &c, const int range,
2074 const turret_data &turret )
2075{
2076 const vehicle *veh_from_turret = turret ? turret.get_veh() : nullptr;
2077 return g->get_creatures_if( [&c, range, veh_from_turret]( const Creature & critter ) -> bool {
2078 if( std::round( rl_dist_exact( c.pos(), critter.pos() ) ) > range )
2079 {
2080 return false;
2081 }
2082
2083 if( !c.sees( critter ) && !c.sees_with_infrared( critter ) )
2084 {
2085 return false;
2086 }
2087
2088 // TODO: get rid of fake npcs (pos() check)
2089 if( &c == &critter || c.pos() == critter.pos() || c.attitude_to( critter ) == Creature::Attitude::A_FRIENDLY )
2090 {
2091 return false;
2092 }
2093
2094 // TODO: It should use projectile passability checks when finding path, not vision checks.
2095 std::vector<tripoint> path = g->m.find_clear_path( c.pos(), critter.pos() );
2096 for( const tripoint &point : path )
2097 {
2098 if( g->m.passable( point ) ) {
2099 // If it's passable, it doesn't block bullets
2100 continue;
2101 }
2102
2103 const vehicle *veh_at_point = veh_pointer_or_null( g->m.veh_at( point ) );
2104 if( veh_at_point && veh_at_point != veh_from_turret ) {
2105 // Vehicles don't have impassable-but-shootable-through parts
2106 return false;
2107 }
2108 if( !g->m.has_flag_ter( TFLAG_TRANSPARENT, point ) ) {
2109 // If it's transparent, it's either glass (fine) or reinforced glass (not fine)
2110 // Hack it with the more common case for now
2111 // TODO: Handle armored glass
2112 return false;
2113 }
2114 }
2115
2116 return true;
2117 } );
2118}
2119
2120int burst_penalty( const Character &p, const item &gun, int gun_recoil )
2121{
2122 ///\EFFECT_DEX reduces burst penalty by flat amount
2123 int dex_effect = p.get_dex() * 10;
2124 ///\EFFECT_STR reduces burst fire penalty
2125 float str_effect = p.get_str() * 0.5f;
2126
2127 /** @EFFECT_PISTOL reduces burst fire penalty */
2128 /** @EFFECT_SMG reduces burst fire penalty */
2129 /** @EFFECT_RIFLE reduces burst fire penalty */
2130 /** @EFFECT_SHOTGUN reduces burst fire penalty */
2131 int skill_lvl = std::min( p.get_skill_level( gun.gun_skill() ), MAX_SKILL );
2132
2133 return std::max<int>( 0, 3 * ( gun_recoil - dex_effect ) / std::max( 1.0f,
2134 str_effect + skill_lvl ) );
2135}
